instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   Bouncing Betty!   I get
threads.message:
I hate bouncing boards!   I have never really mastered running down the signals that can cause the bounce.  Looking for guidance.  

My 3.3v rails are up
Mag light one wire good.

P3V3S6 <SIGNAL>EN_R</SIGNAL> only for a 1/4 second *<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>"  and of course the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>  signal is on only for a 1/4 second.
The bounce lasts about 1/4 a second and never repeats.   One bounce.   Current draw on board is normal for it's state.  
Thermal imaging did not show any red flags.  I didn't expect it to.  I did watch it during the bounce cycle and did not see anything out of the normal.  I did see a few chips turn on as they should. 

I am just looking for some guidance for chasing bouncers like this.   I have already done a detailed physical inspection and checked for shorts on all the rails.  Check the CPU rails.  has to be a signal shutdown of some kind but not sure where to turn.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B   Bouncing Betty!   I get
threads.message:
"P3V3S6 <SIGNAL>EN_R</SIGNAL> only for a 1/4 second"
I suppose is S5 there.
However, which 3V3 rails are up, if <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> enable signal is not stable?
